questionTitle: It will ________ rain later so we should go and have our picnic now.
I would have cleaned the house if I ________ you were coming.
Dave and I have ________ to meet at the bus station at 9 o'clock.
There is always ________ traffic in the city centre at rush hour.
He's a nice man but he's ________ to drink too much at parties.
We must get there ________ or other. If there are no buses, we'll have to take a taxi.
Mrs Townsend was left to make all the ________ for the outing herself.
She ________ type at 40 words per minute.
Hilary: I shan't be more than five or ten minutes now. Alfred: All right. I'll wait over there until ________ ready.
You must move your car at once, Madam; ________ I shall have to give you a ticket.
A manager of a large international company is often given a big ________.
The law states that heavy goods delivery vehicles may not carry ________ of more than fifteen tons.
After the water workers went on strike there was a ________ of water.
He's entitled to a pension, but he won't dream ________ retiring yet.
Mix the contents of this packet ________ a little water.
You can try ________ if you want to improve your English.
His ________ of Richard III was acclaimed as one of the best by any actor.
The army ________ defeat at the hands of its enemies.
Their accounts were completely phony. They had been cooking the ________ for years.
Some practical ________ is desireable for candidates interested in applying for this job.
